text.p: Tropical Storm Niki, with 60 mph winds, is moving westward off the west coast of Luzon, Philippines, and will move over open waters into the South China Sea this period, gaining strength. Conditions will improve over Luzon but shipping in the path of the storm will be threatened.

Tropical Storm Dolly is centered 175 miles southeast of Cozumel, Mexico, moving west northwest at 14 mph. Top winds are 50 mph and further strengthening is likely as Dolly continues to track west northwestward. Tropical storm warnings are up for Belize from San Pedro on Ambergris Caye northward to the border of Mexico, and for the Yucatan Peninsula of Mexico from Chetumal northward and westward to Progreso. Rainfall amounts of 5 to 10 inches are expected along the storm's path into the warned area today.
THERE ARE NO FURTHER EMERGENCY WEATHER STATEMENTS
